hints.label: prop-cloning-energy-dissipation
hints.title: Cloning as Energy Sink
hints.content:
87: :label: prop-cloning-energy-dissipation
88: 
89: The inelastic collision cloning operator **dissipates kinetic energy**, acting as an effective **cooling mechanism** that reduces the stress-energy tensor:
90: 
91: $$
92: \frac{d}{dt}\langle E_{\text{kin}} \rangle_{\text{clone}} = -\frac{1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2}{2\tau_{\text{clone}}} m \langle \|v_{\text{rel}}\|^2 \rangle < 0
93: $$
94: 
95: where $v_{\text{rel}}$ is the relative velocity within collision groups and $\tau_{\text{clone}}$ is the average time between cloning events.
96: 
97: **Derivation**:
98: 
99: Consider the kinetic energy change during an inelastic collision event.
100: 
101: **Before collision**: The collision group $\{i, j_1, \ldots, j_k\}$ has kinetic energy:
102: 
103: $$
104: E_{\text{before}} = \frac{1}{2}m \sum_{a \in \text{group}} \|v_a\|^2
105: $$
106: 
107: **After collision**: Using $v_a' = v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}(v_a - v_{\text{COM}})$:
108: 
109: $$
110: E_{\text{after}} = \frac{1}{2}m \sum_a \|v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}(v_a - v_{\text{COM}})\|^2
111: $$
112: 
113: $$
114: = \frac{1}{2}m(k+1)\|v_{\text{COM}}\|^2 + \frac{1}{2}m\alpha_{\text{rest}}^2 \sum_a \|v_a - v_{\text{COM}}\|^2
115: $$
116: 
117: **Energy loss**:
118: 
119: $$
120: \Delta E = E_{\text{after}} - E_{\text{before}} = -\frac{1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2}{2}m \sum_a \|v_a - v_{\text{COM}}\|^2 < 0
121: $$
122: 
123: The fraction $(1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2)$ of the relative kinetic energy is dissipated.
124: 
125: **Mean-field rate**: At rate $1/\tau_{\text{clone}}$, the average energy dissipation is:
126: 
127: $$
128: \boxed{\frac{d E_{\text{kin}}}{dt}\bigg|_{\text{clone}} = -\frac{1-\alpha_{\text{rest}}^2}{2\tau_{\text{clone}}} m \langle \|v_{\text{rel}}\|^2 \rangle}
129: $$
130: 
131: **Effective cooling**: This acts opposite to Langevin heating ($+\sigma_v^2$ term), leading to a **reduced** effective temperature:
132: 
133: $$
134: k_B T_{\text{eff}} = k_B T_{\text{Langevin}} - \Delta T_{\text{clone}}
135: $$
136:

84: ###2.2 Energy Dissipation and Effective Cooling
85: 
86: :::{prf:proposition} Cloning as Energy Sink
87: :label: prop-cloning-energy-dissipation

95: where $v_{\text{rel}}$ is the relative velocity within collision groups and $\tau_{\text{clone}}$ is the average time between cloning events.

100:

102: 
103: $$

105: $$
106: 
107: **After collision**: Using $v_a' = v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}(v_a - v_{\text{COM}})$:
108: 
109: $$
110: E_{\text{after}} = \frac{1}{2}m \sum_a \|v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}(v_a - v_{\text{COM}})\|^2
111: $$
112: 
113: $$
114: = \frac{1}{2}m(k+1)\|v_{\text{COM}}\|^2 + \frac{1}{2}m\alpha_{\text{rest}}^2 \sum_a \|v_a - v_{\text{COM}}\|^2
115: $$
116: 
117: **Energy loss**:
118: 
119: $$
120: \Delta E = E_{\text{after}} - E_{\text{before}} = -\frac{1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2}{2}m \sum_a \|v_a - v_{\text{COM}}\|^2 < 0
121: $$
122: 
123: The fraction $(1 - \alpha_{\text{rest}}^2)$ of the relative kinetic energy is dissipated.
124: 
125: **Mean-field rate**: At rate $1/\tau_{\text{clone}}$, the average energy dissipation is:
126: 
127: $$
128: \boxed{\frac{d E_{\text{kin}}}{dt}\bigg|_{\text{clone}} = -\frac{1-\alpha_{\text{rest}}^2}{2\tau_{\text{clone}}} m \langle \|v_{\text{rel}}\|^2 \rangle}

hints.label: lem-momentum-conservation-cloning
hints.title: Exact Momentum Conservation
hints.content:
144: :label: lem-momentum-conservation-cloning
145: 
146: The inelastic collision cloning operator **exactly conserves total four-momentum** during each cloning event:
147: 
148: $$
149: \sum_{i=1}^N p^\mu_i \bigg|_{\text{after}} = \sum_{i=1}^N p^\mu_i \bigg|_{\text{before}}
150: $$
151: 
152: **Proof**:
153: 
154: Consider a cloning event where walkers $\{j_1, \ldots, j_k\}$ clone from companion $i$, and walker $\ell$ is killed.
155: 
156: **Before cloning**:
157: $$
158: P^\mu_{\text{before}} = \sum_{a=1}^N m v_a^\mu
159: $$
160: 
161: **After cloning**:
162: - The collision group $\{i, j_1, \ldots, j_k\}$ has velocities updated to:
163:   $$
164:   v_a' = v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}(v_a - v_{\text{COM}})
165:   $$
166: - Total momentum of collision group:
167:   $$
168:   \sum_{a \in \{i,j_1,\ldots,j_k\}} m v_a' = (k+1) m v_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{rest}}\sum_a m(v_a - v_{\text{COM}}) = (k+1) m v_{\text{COM}}
169:   $$
170:   where the second term vanishes by definition of $v_{\text{COM}}$.
171: 
172: - Since $v_{\text{COM}} = \frac{1}{k+1}\sum_a v_a$:
173:   $$
174:   \sum_{a \in \{i,j_1,\ldots,j_k\}} m v_a' = m\sum_{a \in \{i,j_1,\ldots,j_k\}} v_a
175:   $$
176: 
177: **Total momentum after**:
178: $$
179: P^\mu_{\text{after}} = \sum_{a \neq \ell, a \notin \text{collision}} mv_a + \sum_{a \in \text{collision}} mv_a' = P^\mu_{\text{before}}
180: $$
